sen.j: 八幡市（やわたし）は、京都府の南部、大阪府との境界線沿いに位置する市である。
sen.e: Yawata City is a city located in the southern part of Kyoto Prefecture and borders on Osaka Prefecture.
Yawata City is a city located in the southern part of Kyoto Prefecture and borders on Osaka Prefecture.
Yawata City is a city located in the southern part of Kyoto Prefecture and borders on Osaka Prefecture.

sen.j: 石清水八幡宮の門前町として発達した。
sen.e: It was developed as the temple town of Iwashimizu Hachimangu Shrine.
It was developed as the temple town of Iwashimizu Hachimangu Shrine.
It was developed as the temple town of Iwashimizu Hachimangu Shrine.

sen.j: また、1970代以降、京阪電気鉄道樟葉駅（大阪府枚方市）に近い男山地区で、京阪電鉄や日本住宅公団（現・都市再生機構）などがくずはローズタウンや男山団地などの住宅を造成して、大阪市方面のベッドタウンとして人口が短期間で約2倍に増加し、同府の福知山市などを上回った（現在は再び福知山市が八幡市より人口が多くなっている）。
sen.e: Since the Keihan Electric Railway and Nihon Jutaku Kodan (Japan Housing Urban Development Corporation) (present Urban Renaissance Agency) prepared housing sites, such as Kuzuha Rose Town and Otokoyama housing complex in Otokoyama area near Kuzuha Station of the Keihan Electric Railway (Hirakata City Osaka Prefecture) in and after the 1970's, the city became a commuter town for Osaka and thereby the population of the city almost doubled in a short term and surpassed that of Fukuchiyama City, Osaka Prefecture. (Now Fukuchiyama City is more populated than Yawata City.)

Since the Keihan Electric Railway and Nihon Jutaku Kodan (Japan Housing Urban Development Corporation) (present Urban Renaissance Agency) prepared housing sites, such as Kuzuha Rose Town and Otokoyama housing complex in Otokoyama area near Kuzuha Station of the Keihan Electric Railway (Hirakata City Osaka Prefecture) in and after the 1970's, the city became a commuter town for Osaka and thereby the population of the city almost doubled in a short term and surpassed that of Fukuchiyama City, Osaka Prefecture. (Now Fukuchiyama City is more populated than Yawata City.)

Since the Keihan Electric Railway and Nihon Jutaku Kodan (Japan Housing Urban Development Corporation) (present Urban Renaissance Agency) prepared housing sites, such as Kuzuha Rose Town and Otokoyama housing complex in Otokoyama area near Kuzuha Station of the Keihan Electric Railway (Hirakata City Osaka Prefecture) in and after the 1970's, the city became a commuter town for Osaka and thereby the population of the city almost doubled in a short term and surpassed that of Fukuchiyama City, Osaka Prefecture. (Now Fukuchiyama City is more populated than Yawata City.)

sen.j: この人口増により1977年11月1日に市制を施行した。
sen.e: With an increase in the population, Yawata Town was reorganized as Yawata City on November 1, 1977.
With an increase in the population, Yawata Town was reorganized as Yawata City on November 1, 1977.
With an increase in the population, Yawata Town was reorganized as Yawata City on November 1, 1977.

sen.j: 八幡市には幾つかの飛地があり、それらは京都市と久世郡久御山町との境や京田辺市と大阪府枚方市との境に置かれている。
sen.e: Yawata City has its detached areas which are located between Kyoto City and Kumiyama-cho Kusegun, and between Kyotanabe City and Hirakata City Osaka Prefecture.
Yawata City has its detached areas which are located between Kyoto City and Kumiyama-cho Kusegun, and between Kyotanabe City and Hirakata City Osaka Prefecture.
Yawata City has its detached areas which are located between Kyoto City and Kumiyama-cho, Kuse-gun, and between Kyotanabe City and Hirakata City, Osaka Prefecture.

sen.j: 地理
sen.e: Geography
Geography
Geography

sen.j: 山 男山 三角点は鳩ヶ峰(142.5m)（愛称：八幡山、「はちまんさん」と読む）
sen.e: Mountain: Otokoyama Mountain whose triangulation point is Hatogamine peak (142.5m)(Nickname: Hachimansan)
Mountain: Otokoyama Mountain whose triangulation point is Hatogamine peak (142.5m)(Nickname: Hachimansan)
Mountain: Mt. Otoko whose triangulation point is Hatogamine peak (142.5 m)(Nickname: Hachimansan)

sen.j: 河川 木津川 (京都府)、宇治川、淀川
sen.e: River: Kizu-kawa River (Kyoto Prefecture), Uji River, and Yodo-gawa River
River: Kizu-kawa River (Kyoto Prefecture), Uji River, and Yodo-gawa River
River: Kizu-gawa River (Kyoto Prefecture), Uji-gawa River, and Yodo-gawa River

sen.j: 木津川を挟んで久世郡久御山町、洞ヶ峠を越えて大阪府枚方市に接している。市の中央を国道1号が南北に貫いている。
sen.e: The city has borders with Kumiyama-cho Kusegun across the Kizu-kawa River and with Hirakata City, Osaka Prefecture over Horaga-toge mountain pass, and National highway Route No. 1 runs through the center of the city..

The city has borders with Kumiyama-cho Kusegun across the Kizu-kawa River and with Hirakata City, Osaka Prefecture over Horaga-toge mountain pass, and National highway Route No. 1 runs through the center of the city..

The city has borders with Kumiyama-cho, Kuse-gun across the Kizu-gawa River and with Hirakata City, Osaka Prefecture over Horaga-toge mountain pass, and National Route 1 runs through the center of the city.
sen.cmt: 地名の表現を修正しました。

sen.j: 国道1号と直交するような形で府道や市道が整備されており、京田辺市とつながっている。
sen.e: Prefectural and municipal roads, which lead to Kyotanabe City, are arranged in such a manner as they meet the National Highway Route No. 1 at right angles.
Prefectural and municipal roads, which lead to Kyotanabe City, are arranged in such a manner as they meet the National Highway Route No. 1 at right angles.
Prefectural and municipal roads, which lead to Kyotanabe City, are arranged in such a manner as they meet the National Route 1 at right angles.
sen.cmt: 国道→National Route としました。

sen.j: 市の西側は淀川で、対岸に京都府乙訓郡大山崎町、大阪府三島郡島本町、大阪府高槻市を眺望できる。
sen.e: The eastern edge of the city is the Yodo River, over which Oyamazaki-cho Otokuni-gun Kyoto Prefecture, Shimamoto-cho Mishima-gun Osaka Prefecture, and Takatsuki City Osaka Prefecture can be seen.
The eastern edge of the city is the Yodo River, over which Oyamazaki-cho Otokuni-gun Kyoto Prefecture, Shimamoto-cho Mishima-gun Osaka Prefecture, and Takatsuki City Osaka Prefecture can be seen.

The western edge of the city is the Yodo-gawa River, over which Oyamazaki-cho Otokuni-gun Kyoto Prefecture, Shimamoto-cho Mishima-gun Osaka Prefecture, and Takatsuki City Osaka Prefecture can be seen.

sen.j: 市の北端のかわきた自然運動公園内に、木津川 (京都府)、宇治川、桂川 (淀川水系)の3川合流点がある。
sen.e: There is a joining of the Kizu-kawa River, Uji River, and the Yodo-gawa River in Kawakita Nature and Sports Park located in the northern edge of the city.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: There is a joining of the Kizu-kawa River, Uji River, and the Yodo-gawa River in Kawakita Nature and Sports Park located in the northern edge of the city.
There is a joining of the Kizu-gawa River, Uji-gawa River, and the Yodo-gawa River in Kawakita Nature and Sports Park located in the northern edge of the city.

sen.j: 近くを通る国道478号で大山崎町とつながっている。
sen.e: The National Highway Route No. 478 running near the part connects the city with city Oyamazaki-cho.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The National Highway Route No. 478 running near the part connects the city with city Oyamazaki-cho.
The National Route 478 running near the part connects the city with Oyamazaki-cho.

sen.j: 鉄道駅は3駅ある。
sen.e: The city has three railway stations.
The city has three railway stations.
The city has three railway stations.

sen.j: 京阪本線の八幡市駅・橋本駅 (京都府)。
sen.e: Yawatashi Station and Hashimoto Station of the Keihan Main Line.
Yawatashi Station and Hashimoto Station of the Keihan Main Line.
Yawatashi Station and Hashimoto Station (Kyoto Prefecture) of the Keihan Main Line.

sen.j: 京阪鋼索線の男山山上駅。
sen.e: Otokoyamasanjo Station of the Keihan Kosaku-sen cable car line.
Otokoyamasanjo Station of the Keihan Kosaku-sen cable car line.
Otokoyamasanjo Station of the Keihan Kosaku-sen cable car line.

sen.j: 八幡市駅には急行・準急・普通が停車する。
sen.e: Express, semi-express and local trains stop at Yawatashi Station.
Express, semi-express and local trains stop at Yawatashi Station.
Express, semi-express and local trains stop at Yawatashi Station.

sen.j: 橋本駅は普通・準急のみ停車する。
sen.e: Only local and semi-express trains stop at Hashimoto Station.
Only local and semi-express trains stop at Hashimoto Station.
Only local and semi-express trains stop at Hashimoto Station.

sen.j: 鋼索線は市内一の名所である石清水八幡宮への参詣客が利用する。
sen.e: Visitors to Iwashimizu Hachimangu Shrine, the most important place of interest, take the Kosaku-sen Line.
Visitors to Iwashimizu Hachimangu Shrine, the most important place of interest, take the Kosaku-sen Line.
Visitors to Iwashimizu Hachimangu Shrine, the most important place of interest, take the Kosaku-sen Line.

sen.j: バス路線が非常に充実している。
sen.e: The bus network has been well developed.
The bus network has been well developed.
The bus network has been well developed.

sen.j: 京阪バスが、京阪本線の樟葉駅と八幡市駅を軸に多数の系統を設けており利用率も充分によい。
sen.e: Keihan Bus Ltd offers a variety of networks mainly between Kuzuha Station and Yawata Station and has high passenger load factors.
Keihan Bus Ltd offers a variety of networks mainly between Kuzuha Station and Yawata Station and has high passenger load factors.
Keihan Bus offers a variety of networks mainly between Kuzuha Station and Yawatashi Station and has high passenger load factors.

sen.j: 男山を取り巻くように住宅地や田園が広がり、特に男山西側の地域は男山団地と呼ばれる人口密集地である。
sen.e: Residential areas and rural zones spread as if they surround Otokoyama; in particular the western side is an densely populate area.
Residential areas and rural zones spread as if they surround Otokoyama; in particular the western side is an densely populate area.

sen.j: 沿革
sen.e: Outline
Outline
Outline

sen.j: 1889年（明治22年）4月1日、町村制施行に伴い、綴喜郡八幡町、都々城村、有智郷村が発足。
sen.e: On April 1, 1889, Yawata-machi Tsuzuki-gun, Tsuzuki-mura, and Uchigo-mura were founded when the municipal organization was enforced.
On April 1, 1889, Yawata-machi Tsuzuki-gun, Tsuzuki-mura, and Uchigo-mura were founded when the municipal organization was enforced.
April 1, 1889: Yawata-machi, Tsuzuki-mura, and Uchigo-mura were founded in Tsuzuki-gun when the municipal organization was enforced.
sen.cmt: 綴喜郡にこれら３つの村ができたようですので、翻訳を変更しました（参考：http://homepage1.nifty.com/ishato/tiri/sityoson/05kinki/26_kyo11.htm）"On April 1, 1889,"→"April 1, 1889:"に変更しました。

sen.j: 1954年（昭和29年）10月1日、上記3町村が合併して八幡町となる。
sen.e: In October 1, 1954, Yawata-machi Tsuzuki-gun, Tsuzuki-mura, and Uchigo-mura were merged to become Yawata-machi.
In October 1, 1954, Yawata-machi Tsuzuki-gun, Tsuzuki-mura, and Uchigo-mura were merged to become Yawata-machi.
October 1, 1954: The above three villages were merged to become Yawata-machi.
sen.cmt: 原文どおりに修正しました。"In October 1, 1954, the"→"October 1, 1954: The"に変更しました。

sen.j: 1977年（昭和52年）11月1日、市制を施行し、京都府内で11番目の市となる。
sen.e: In November 1, 1977, Yawata-machi became the 11th city of Kyoto Prefecture when it was reorganized as Yawata City.
In November 1, 1977, Yawata-machi became the 11th city of Kyoto Prefecture when it was reorganized as Yawata City.
November 1, 1977: Yawata-machi became the eleventh city of Kyoto Prefecture when it was reorganized as Yawata City.
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。"In November 1, 1977,"→"November 1, 1977:"に変更しました。

sen.e: Administration
Administration

sen.j: 産業の規模は人口の割に小さい。
sen.e: The scale of its industry is the smaller for its large population.
The scale of its industry is the smaller for its large population.
The scale of its industry is the smaller for its large population.

sen.j: 農業の比率が高く、梨が名産品として定評がある。
sen.e: The agriculture makes up the highest rate of the its industry and pears have high reputation as its specialty.
The agriculture makes up the highest rate of the its industry and pears have high reputation as its specialty.
The agriculture makes up the highest rate of the its industry and pears have high reputation as its specialty.

sen.j: 秋には観光梨園が開かれる。
sen.e: The pear farms are open to public in Autumn.

sen.j: 工業は主として国道1号線沿いに立地している。
sen.e: Industrial facilities are located along the National Highway Route No. 1.
Industrial facilities are located along the National Highway Route No. 1.
Industrial facilities are located along the National Route 1.
sen.cmt: 国道→National Route としました。

sen.j: 金属加工などが代表的である。
sen.e: Metalworking is its typical industry.
Metalworking is its typical industry.
Metalworking is its typical industry.

sen.j: 立地を活かし、倉庫・物流拠点としての利用もある。
sen.e: The city offers sites for the physical distribution center and warehouses because of its convenient location.
The city has many physical distribution centers and warehouses because of its convenient location.
The city has many physical distribution centers and warehouses because of its convenient location.

sen.j: 商業は八幡市ではあまり栄えていない。
sen.e: The commerce is not well prosperous.
However, commerce has not propered in the city.
However, commerce has not prospered in the city.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 大型店舗はイズミヤ八幡店が目立つくらいである。
sen.e: Only Izumiya Yawata Branch can be seen as a large scale retailer.
Only Izumiya Yawata Branch can be seen as a large scale retailer.
Only Izumiya Yawata Branch can be seen as a large scale retailer.

sen.j: 八幡市の人口を大きく支える男山団地と周辺の邸宅街での消費は枚方市楠葉地区に流れており、市内での滞留率が非常に低い。
sen.e: Consumers who live in the Otokoyam housing complex and its surrounding residential areas--Yawata City's large portion of the population--go out to Hirakata City Kuzuha area and the rate of their consumptions within the city is quite low.

Consumers who live in the Otokoyama housing complex and its surrounding residential areas--Yawata City's large portion of the population--go out to Hirakata City Kuzuha area and the rate of consumption within the city is quite low.

Consumers who live in the Otokoyama housing complex and its surrounding residential areas--Yawata City's large portion of the population--go out to Hirakata City Kuzuha area and the rate of consumption within the city is quite low.

sen.j: また近年開発が進んだ市東部の邸宅街には小規模ながら商業地区が形成されているものの、隣接する久御山町や京田辺市にある大型店に客が流れている。
sen.e: In addition, recently developed residential areas of the eastern part of the city has a commercial district, but it is in such a small scale that customers flow out to large retailers in Kumiyama-cho and Kyotanabe City.

In addition, recently developed residential areas of the eastern part of the city have a commercial district, but it is on such a small scale that customers flow out to large retailers in Kumiyama-cho and Kyotanabe City.

In addition, recently developed residential areas of the eastern part of the city have a commercial district, but it is on such a small scale that customers flow out to large retailers in Kumiyama-cho and Kyotanabe City.

sen.j: 客が流れていることと同時に、雇用機会も流れてしまい、ゆえに市の財政事情は厳しい。
sen.e: In addition to the outflow of customers, employment opportunities also flow out of city, thereby the municipal finance is severe.
In addition to the outflow of customers, employment opportunities also flow out of city, bringing down the municipal financial situation.
In addition to the outflow of customers, employment opportunities also flow out of city, bringing down the municipal financial situation.

sen.j: 八幡市駅 - 橋本駅 (京都府)（- 樟葉駅）
sen.e: Yawata Station - Hashimoto Station (Kyoto Prefecture) (- Kuzuha Station)
Yawata Station - Hashimoto Station (Kyoto Prefecture) (- Kuzuha Station)
Yawatashi Station - Hashimoto Station (Kyoto Prefecture) (- Kuzuha Station)

sen.j: 八幡市駅が当市の玄関駅であるが、駅付近の道が狭いこともあり、八幡市内のバス路線の多くは大阪府枚方市にある樟葉駅に発着する。
sen.e: Though Yawata Station is supposed to be the main entrance of the city, roads around it are so small that many bus lines within Yawata City arrive in and depart from Kuzuha Station in Hirakata City, Osaka Prefecture.

Though Yawata Station is supposed to be the main entrance of the city, roads around it are so small that many bus lines within Yawata City arrive in and depart from Kuzuha Station in Hirakata City, Osaka Prefecture.

Although Yawatashi Station is supposed to be the main entrance of the city, roads around it are so small that many bus lines within Yawata City arrive in and depart from Kuzuha Station in Hirakata City, Osaka Prefecture.
sen.cmt: Yawatashi としました。"Though"→"Although"に変更しました。

sen.j: 2003年9月以降は樟葉駅に特急が停車するようになり、八幡市駅を通る急行が大幅減少したため、現在事実上の八幡市の玄関駅は樟葉駅になっている。
sen.e: Since special express trains started to stop Kuzuha Station in September 2003, the number of express trains that stop at Yawata Station greatly decreased; Kuzuha Station, in effect, serves as the main entrance of Yawata City.

Since special express trains started to stop in Kuzuha Station in September 2003, the number of express trains that stop at Yawata Station greatly decreased; Kuzuha Station, in effect, serves as the main entrance of Yawata City.

Since special express trains started to stop in Kuzuha Station in September 2003, the number of express trains that stop at Yawatashi Station greatly decreased; Kuzuha Station, in effect, serves as the main entrance of Yawata City.

sen.j: 現在、八幡市駅の乗客数は樟葉駅の1/5しかない。
sen.e: The number of passengers of Yawata Station is only one-fifth those of Kuzuha Station,.
The number of passengers of Yawata Station is only one-fifth of those of Kuzuha Station,.
The number of passengers of Yawatashi Station is only one-fifth of those of Kuzuha Station.

sen.j: なお、2003年9月の京阪本線ダイヤ改正に際して、八幡市長が京阪に対して樟葉駅への特急停車を要請した。
sen.e: For reference, the Mayor of Yawata City requested Keihan Electric Railway that special express trains stop at Kuzuha Station.
For reference, the Mayor of Yawata City requested Keihan Electric Railway that special express trains stop at Kuzuha Station.
For reference, the Mayor of Yawata City requested Keihan Electric Railway that special express trains stop at Kuzuha Station upon the timetable revision of September, 2003.

Keihan Buses are in service.
Keihan Buses are in service.

sen.j: 市の東部は京阪バス京田辺営業所のエリアであるがそれ以外は本市に位置する京阪バス男山営業所が運行している（一部例外あり）。
sen.e: Keihan Bus Co.,Ltd. Otokoyama Office located within the city offers bus services in almost all areas except for the eastern part of the city covered by its Kyotanabe Office. (with exceptions)
Keihan Bus Co., Ltd. Otokoyama Office located within the city offers bus service in almost all areas except for the eastern part of the city covered by its Kyotanabe Office (with exceptions).

sen.j: 道路
sen.e: Road
Road
Roads
sen.cmt: 他の記事ファイルと統一しました。

sen.j: 隣市の枚方市が｢京阪間にろくな道無し」と言われるのに対して、八幡市では市街地においても大きな渋滞が発生することは少ない。
sen.e: Congestions rarely occur even in a urban district in Yawata City; in contrast its neighbor city, Hirakata City is noted or words that there are no roads to speak of between Kyoto and Hanshin region.
Congestions rarely occur even in the urban district of Yawata City; in contrast its neighbor city, Hirakata City is noted that there are no roads to speak of between the Kyoto and Hanshin region.
Congestions rarely occur even in the urban district of Yawata City; in contrast its neighbor city, Hirakata City is noted that there are no roads to speak of between the Kyoto and Osaka region.

sen.j: 開発段階から生活道路と産業道路や幹線道路の分離が考慮されてきたことが伺える。
sen.e: This is because the separation among the community road, industrial road, and the highway has been taken into consideration since the onset of the development.
This is because the separation among the community road, industrial road, and the highway has been taken into consideration since the onset of development.
This is because the separation among the community road, industrial road, and the highway has been taken into consideration since the onset of development.

sen.j: しかし、第二京阪道路や京都第二外環状道路が開通する以前は国道1号、京都府道・大阪府道13号京都守口線、京都府道22号八幡木津線などは市域において混雑が顕著であった。
sen.e: However, such roads as the National highway Route No. 1, Kyoto Prefecture and Osaka Prefecture Road Route No. l3 Kyoto Moriguchi Line, and Kyoto Prefecture Road No. 22 Yawata-Kizu Road had been apparently congested within the city before the Dainikeihan Road and the second outside beltways of Kyoto opened.

However, such roads as the National highway Route No. 1, Kyoto Prefecture and Osaka Prefecture Road Route No. l3 Kyoto Moriguchi Line, and Kyoto Prefecture Road No. 22 Yawata-Kizu Road had been apparently congested within the city before the Dainikeihan Road and the second outside beltways of Kyoto opened.

However, such roads as the National Route 1, the Kyoto Moriguchi Line of Kyoto Prefectural and Osaka Prefectural Route 13, and Yawata-Kizu Line of Kyoto Prefectural Route 22 had been apparently congested within the city before the Dainikeihan Road and Kyoto Second Outer Ring Road opened.
sen.cmt: 道路名を他の記事ファイルと統一しました。"Kyoto Moriguchi Line"→"the Kyoto Moriguchi Line"に変更しました。
